p: In the 20th century, forest productivity in Europe has increased ( Spiecker et al 1996 , Boisvenue and Running 2006). Simultaneously, damage from disturbances, i.e. discrete events destroying forest biomass, has increased as well ( Schelhaas et al 2003 , Seidl et al 2014 ). Both trends are partly associated with a changing climate ( Boisvenue and Running 2006, Seidl et al 2011 ), and future projections mostly agree on continued changes in forest productivity ( Wamelink et al 2009 , Reyer et al 2014 ) and disturbances (e.g. Lindner et al 2010 , Seidl et al 2014 ) due to ongoing climate change.
